document.docAuthor: Mauffray, William F. & Tennessen, Kenneth J.
document.masterDocTitle: A Catalogue and Historical Study of the Odonata of Ecuador

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A Catalogue and Historical Study of the Odonata of Ecuador

subSubSection.paragraph: Forty-three species have been described in this strictly New World genus, with six known for Ecuador . However, the genus is in need of revision, and there are potentially undescribed species in Ecuador . The few references by which some species identifications can be made are Calvert (1931) and Kennedy (1938a , 1942a ). Adults are mediumsized, mostly dark with small blue stripes and spots on the thorax; the abdomen varies from nearly all black to blue on the apical segments ( Figs. 54a & 54b ). Little work has been done on the biology of this genus, though all species have been found in the vicinity of small shaded streams and seepage areas.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 54a.
Palaemnema abbreviata
♂, ECUADOR, Orellana Province, 14 x 2009; photo K. J. Tennessen.

subSubSection.paragraph:
